text: The first season of The Four Brasil, hosted by Xuxa Meneghel and judged by Aline Wirley, João Marcello Bôscoli and Leo Chaves, premiered Wednesday, February 6, 2019 at 10:30 p.m. (BRT / AMT) on RecordTV. The winner is awarded a R$300.000 cash prize. ==The Four== ;Key : – Challenger against The Four won and secured a seat as a new member. : – Member of The Four did not perform. : – Member of The Four won the challenge and secured a seat. : – Member of The Four lost the challenge and was eliminated. : – Challenger to The Four lost the challenge and was eliminated. : – Artist was chosen to return and earned a chance to challenge The Four. : – Artist was chosen to return but lost the chance to challenge The Four. : – Artist was not in the competition. : – Final member of The Four. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan=03 width=120| Artists ! colspan=10 | Episodes |- ! rowspan=2 width=80| 1 ! rowspan=2 width=80| 2 ! rowspan=2 width=80| 3 ! rowspan=2 width=80| 4 ! rowspan=2 width=80| 5 ! rowspan=2 width=80| 6 ! colspan=2 | 7 ! colspan=2 | 8 |- ! width=80| ! width=80| ! width=80| ! width=80| |- | bgcolor=87CEEB| Ivan Lima | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| | bgcolor=F888FD| WIN | IN | bgcolor=F5F5DC| | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| WIN | bgcolor=FFD700| WINNER |- | bgcolor=87CEEB| Vivian Lemos | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=5| | bgcolor=F888FD| WIN | bgcolor=F5F5DC| | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| WIN | bgcolor=C0C0C0| |- | bgcolor=87CEEB| Leo Mahuad | bgcolor=A9A9A9| | bgcolor=F888FD| WIN | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F5F5DC| | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=FA8072| OUT | bgcolor=A9A9A9 rowspan=2| |- | bgcolor=87CEEB| Nega | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=2| | bgcolor=F888FD| WIN | IN | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=F5F5DC| | bgcolor=F3F781| SAFE | bgcolor=FA8072| OUT |- ! 5.1 | Santaella | "If I Ain't Got You" | Eliminated |-bgcolor=FFE87C ! 5.2 | Vivian Lemos | "(You Make Me Feel Like)..." | Put in seat 2 |- |} ==Comeback episode== ===Week 7 (Mar. 20)=== *Group performance: "Stronger (What Doesn't Kill You)" ====Part 1: Head-to-Head Battle==== The comeback artists are split into pairs for their first performances. The audience selected one from each pair to immediately challenge one of the members of "The Four". {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:55%;" |- ! scope="col" width="05%" | Order ! scope="col" width="15%" | Artist ! scope="col" width="25%" | Song ! scope="col" width="15%" | Challenge result |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 1.1 | Victor Filgueira | "Crazy in Love" | Eliminated |- ! 1.2 | Rully | "Umbrella" | Avanced |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 3.1 | Arthur Olliver | "The Way You Make Me Feel" | Eliminated |- ! 3.2 | Erik Moraes | "Always" | Avanced |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |- ! 5.1 | Stanya | "Killing Me Softly with His Song" | Avanced |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 5.2 | Tay Rodriguez | "Try" | Eliminated |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 7.1 | Santaella | "Me de Motivos" | Eliminated |- ! 7.2 | Manso | "Tente Outra Vez" | Avanced |} ====Part 2: Comeback Challenge==== After winning their Head-to-Head battles, the four comeback artists each immediately challenged a member of "The Four" for an opportunity to claim a seat. {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; width:55%;" |- ! scope="col" width="05%" | Order ! scope="col" width="15%" | Artist ! scope="col" width="25%" | Song ! scope="col" width="15%" | Challenge result |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 2.1 | Rully | "Como Nossos Pais" | Eliminated |- ! 2.2 | Nega | "Envolvidão" | Safe |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 4.1 | Erik Moraes | "Volta pra Mim" | Eliminated |- ! 4.2 | Leo Mahuad | "O Tempo Não Para" | Safe |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 6.1 | Stanya | "Ginga" | Eliminated |- ! 6.2 | Vivian Lemos | "Hello" | Safe |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 8.1 | Manso | "Iris" | Eliminated |- ! 8.2 | Ivan Lima | "Bohemian Rhapsody" | Safe |- |} ==Finale== ===Week 8 (Mar. 27)=== *Group performance: "This Is Me" *Musical guest: Ludmilla ("Clichê" / "Cheguei") ====Part 1: Head-to-Head Battle==== Each finalist performed two songs. For the first song, each finalist performed in hopes of winning over the audience. After performing, the audience voted for their favorite performance, and the finalist with the most votes earned the power to choose who they wanted to battle against in the head-to-head challenge. For the second song, each selected pair went head-to- head. The public picked a winner from each pair to move on to the final battle. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:55%;" |- |+ Selection Power performances ! scope="col" width="05%" | Order ! scope="col" width="15%" | Artist ! scope="col" width="25%" | Song ! scope="col" width="15%" | Result |- ! 1 | Nega | "Jack Soul Brasileiro" | Did not receive |- ! 2 | Vivian Lemos | "Nada Mais" | Did not receive |-bgcolor=FFFF00 ! 3 | Ivan Lima | "The Show Must Go On" | Selected Leo |- ! 4 | Leo Mahuad | "Mercy" | Did not receive |- |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:55%;" |- |+Head-to-Head performances ! scope="col" width="05%" | Order ! scope="col" width="15%" | Artist ! scope="col" width="25%" | Song ! scope="col" width="15%" | Result |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 5 | Leo Mahuad | "I Just Wanna Make Love to You" | Eliminated |- ! 6 | Ivan Lima | "Hallelujah" | Advanced |- | bgcolor=A9A9A9 colspan=4| |-bgcolor=FFB6C1 ! 7 | Nega | "Canta Brasil" | Eliminated |- ! 8 | Vivian Lemos | "Earth Song" | Advanced |- |} ====Part 2: The Final Two Battle==== For the final battle, the two finalists performed once more for the votes from the Brazilian public. The winner of this battle would be crowned the winner of The Four Brasil. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:55%;" |- |+The Final Two performances ! scope="col" width="05%" | Order ! scope="col" width="15%" | Artist ! scope="col" width="25%" | Song ! scope="col" width="15%" | Result |-bgcolor=C0C0C0 ! 9 | Vivian Lemos | "Love Hurts" | Runner-up |-bgcolor=FFD700 ! 10 | Ivan Lima | "Stairway to Heaven" | Winner |- |} Following the announcement that Lima had won, he performed "Angels". ==Ratings and reception== ===Brazilian ratings=== All numbers are in points and provided by Kantar Ibope Media. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%; width: 100%" ! width="05.0%"| Episode ! width="07.5%"| Title ! width="07.5%"| Air date ! width="07.5%"| Timeslot (BRT) ! width="05.0%"| SP viewers (in points) ! width="05.0%"| Source |- | 1 | Week 1 | February 6, 2019 | rowspan=8| Wednesday 10:30 p.m. | 7.4 | |- | 2 | Week 2 | February 13, 2019 | 6.9 | |- | 3 | Week 3 | February 20, 2019 | 6.5 | |- | 4 | Week 4 | February 27, 2019 | 6.6 | |- | 5 | Week 5 | March 6, 2019 | 6.4 | |- | 6 | Week 6 | March 13, 2019 | 6.7 | |- | 7 | Week 7 | March 20, 2019 | 6.9 | |- | 8 | Winner announced | March 27, 2019 | 6.2 | |- |} * ==References== ==External links== * The Four Brasil on R7.com Category:2019 Brazilian television seasons
